page.title: 18ATTITUDES, WARLEY: DATA
page.content: In mid June a sample of 45 people in the area were stopped and asked to tick from a list of fifty phrases or adjectives those which they thought best described the block. The twelve most frequently picked were:{Parks (64%),{High Car Ownership}(60%), {Council Estates}(60%),{Green and Leafy (58%),{High House Prices}(53%), {Commuting}(51%),{Green Belt}(51%), Clean (44%), Lots of Traffic (42%), Friendly (40%), Good Shopping Facilities (38%), Growing Population (38%). In contrast, the twelve least frequently picked were:{Militant}(2%), {Poverty}(2%),{Aggressive}(9%),{Lots to {Do}(11%),{Grey}(11%),{Isolated}(13%), Overcrowded (16%), Depressed (16%), Good Social Life (18%), Pollution (18%), Rapid Expansion (18%), In a Hurry (20%).
